com.foreach.across.modules.entity.views.processors

Class SortableTableRenderingViewProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.across.modules.entity.views.processors.EntityViewProcessorAdapter
      • com.foreach.across.modules.entity.views.processors.SortableTableRenderingViewProcessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EntityViewProcessor

    @Component
 @Exposed
 @Scope(value="prototype")
public class SortableTableRenderingViewProcessor
extends EntityViewProcessorAdapter
    Renders a list of items as a sortable table using a SortableTableBuilder. Expects either a Page or List attribute to be available on the EntityView under the name AbstractEntityFetchingViewProcessor.DEFAULT_ATTRIBUTE_NAME. If no Page is available as that attribute, the table will not get created.

    Will create a SortableTableBuilder and store it as TABLE_BUILDER so following processors can modify it. During rendering the builder will be added to the general container.

    In addition to regular rendering of table results, this processor also supports adding the default EntityListActionsProcessor and optionally enabling a summary view if the EntityConfiguration has a view with the specified setSummaryViewName(String).

    Since:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Arne Vandamme

        public void setIncludeDefaultActions(boolean includeDefaultActions)

        Defaults to false.

      • setSummaryViewName

        public void setSummaryViewName(String summaryViewName)
        Name of the summary view. If this is set and the view exists, a summary detail view will be available for every entity row. Defaults to EntityView.SUMMARY_VIEW_NAME.

      • setTableName

        Set the name of the table, added as data attributes in the markup.

        Defaults to itemsTable.

      • setSortableProperties

        public void setSortableProperties(Collection<String> sortableProperties)
